intro: Poranthera asybosca, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as coastal dunes and disturbed areas. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The species is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
